p: In the present study, HPLC-UV was used to analyze the hydroethanolic extract of E. grandiflorum leaves qualitatively. The results revealed the presence of different phenolic compounds might be responsible for strong antioxidant potential of E. genadiflorum includes Gallic Acid (Rt = 2.808), Catechin (Rt = 3.257), Chlorogenic acid (Rt = 5.366), HB acid (Rt = 6.893), Caffeic acid (Rt = 7.969), Sinapic acid (Rt = 12.954) and Ferulic acid (Rt = 13.416). The results of HPLC also revealed some peaks with different retention time could not be identified; however, based on their chromatographic behaviors and UV spectra, they may correspond to unknown flavonoids compounds as presented in respective chromatogram ( Figure 2).
